* Master Data Management: Experience with enterprise-level master data management, including data governance and quality. Used to working with data mining to uncover pattens, anomalies and correlations in large data sets.
* Data Analysis and Processing: Comprehensive skills in data analysis, processing, and visualization using tools like Excel and SQL.
* Scripting and Programming: Competence in scripting and programming (e.g., Python or SQL) to manipulate and analyze large datasets.
* Documentation and Communication: Ability to document complex data processes and communicate technical information clearly in English.
* Data modelling: Using tools like Erwin, Visio or similar, to visualise metadata and database schema.


**Why Join Us?** 
 By joining GlobalConnect, you'll be at the heart of one of the most progressive telecom companies in Northern Europe. You'll have the chance to directly influence our success through precise and efficient data integration. We offer a collaborative and innovative environment where your contributions will have a real impact.
   

  

 If you're ready to solve complex challenges and make a significant impact with your data expertise, we want to hear from you. Apply today and let's build a data-driven future together!
   

  

**Apply Now!** 
 We look forward to starting this journey with you.

title: Experienced IT Architect, Asset & Wealth Management
description:
**Job ID: 24969**
**Digital Solutions, Wealth Management, Investments and Savings** 






  

  



 Would you like to influence the future digital bank? We are now looking for an experienced IT Architect to lead architectural solution design within Asset & Wealth Management (AWM) for future offerings and digital channel solutions, that will realize Nordea’s Digital Strategy. We aim to exploit leading edge digital innovations to make Nordea more personal, convinient, relevant, and proactive.    
 





  

  



 In Nordea, we’re harnessing the power of technology to reinvent the future of banking. A tech revolution is underway – and you can make an impact. Working with international teams in an inspiring working environment, you’ll have lots of opportunities to expand your skills and advance your career.  
   

  





**About this opportunity**




 Welcome to the AWM Architecture team. We add value by architecting next generation digital solution, product and service offerings for Nordea customer regarding Savings and Investments. As an IT Architect, you’ll play a valuable role in defining how our change initiatives can meet customer and business demands by providing easy to follow architecture designs and guidelines.
   

  

**What you’ll be doing:** 





* Work closely with primary stakeholders in AWM and across the Nordea Group, incl. subsidiaries like Nordea Asset Management and Nordea Life & Pension in the Nordic
* Adding knowledge and supporting the AWM Architecture team to improve
* Draw on existing architectures and technology standards to determine feasible options
* Help reducing the complexity at Nordea through reuse of solutions and components
* Drive design decisions for the the solution architecture and document the result
* Interact with build teams to ensure the architecture is communicated properly
* Interact with the wider architecture community to facilitate learning and maturation
* Work with systematic documentation in Architecture Tools



  

  



 You’ll join a dynamic and experienced international team. The role is based in Gdańsk; Gdynia; Helsinki; Stockholm; Warszawa.
   

  





**Who you are**




 Collaboration. Ownership. Passion. Courage. These are the values that guide us in being at our best – and that we imagine you share with us.  
   

  

**To succeed in this role, we believe that you:** 





* Analytical in clarifying problems to be solved
* Innovative in coming up with solutions and architectures
* Influential in driving solution implementation
* A good team player
* Structured and systematic



  

  



**Your experience and background:** 





* Driving solution architecture designs in banking or similar industries
* Driving alignment and resolving conflicts across stakeholders like Product Owners, Legal, Developers, Operations etc.
* Contributing constructive feedback to fellow architecture community members and contributing to the maturation of the architecture practice
* 5-10 years of acting in the IT Architecture field



  
 





 If this sounds like you, get in touch!
 





  
 





**Next steps**




 Submit your application no later than 12/08/2024. For more information, you’re welcome to contact Tomas Betzholtz at tomas.betzholtz@nordea.com.
   

  

 At Nordea, we know that an inclusive workplace is a sustainable workplace. We deeply believe that our diverse backgrounds, experiences, characteristics and traits make us better at serving customers and communities. So please come as you are.
 





  
 





**Only for candidates in Sweden:** 
  For union information, please contact finansforbundet@nordea.se or SACONordea@nordea.com.
   

  

**Only for candidateds in Poland:** 
 Please include permit for processing personal data in CV as following:
   

  

 In accordance with art. 6 (1) a and b. Regulation (EU) 2016/679 of the European Parliament and of the Council of 27 April 2016 on the protection of natural persons with regard to the processing of personal data and on the free movement of such data, and repealing Directive 95/46/EC (General Data Protection Regulation) hereinafter ‘GDPR’. I agree to have: my personal data, education and employment history proceeded for the purposes of current and future recruitment processes in Nordea Bank Abp.
   

  

 The administrator of your personal data is: Nordea Bank Abp operating in Poland through its Branch, address: Aleja Edwarda Rydza Śmiglego 20, 93-281 Łodź. Your personal data will be processed for the recruitment processes in Nordea Bank Abp. You have a right to access your personal data, right to rectify and right to delete. Disclosing the personal data in the scope specified by the provisions of Polish Labour Code from 26 June 1974 and executive acts are mandatory. Providing personal data is necessary to conduct the recruitment processes. The request for the deletion of your personal data means resignation from further participation in recruitment processes and causes the immediate removal of your application. Detailed information concerning processing of your personal data can be found at: nordea.com/en/doc/nordea-privacy-policy-for-applicants.pdf.
   

  

 We reserve the right to reply only to selected applications.

title: Product owner - Engineering Change Management CAD processes and systems
description:
Are you getting energy by understanding user needs? Are you enjoying team work? Have you heard that you are good in communication? Do you have knowledge about product development and Engineering Change Management? Then you might be our new colleague!
   

  

**About Us**
 Scania is now undergoing a transformation from being a supplier of trucks, buses and engines to a supplier of complete and sustainable transport solutions.
   

  

 The trucks, buses and power solutions in these transport solutions are developed in our CAD platform by the designers at our R&D departments. Our aim is to create the best possible experience for our users. We put the user in the centre when we develop our methods, processes and the CAD platform. Our organisation is responsible for strategy, methods and tools for the virtual description of Scania’s products. We work together with business and IT in a Value Creation Team (VCT), where we also have members from other brands in our Traton family.
   

  

 For us it is important with an sustainable mindset, our company culture with our core values are close to our hearts and supports our customers, people and our planet.
   

  

**About The Assignments**
 We are looking for a Product owner/Business IT Analyst to the team working with Engineering Change Management.
   

  

 All drawings and technical documentation describing our products are sent for review and approval in our PDM system, where all changes needs to be traceable and changed objects version managed.
   

  

 The assignment is about understanding the users and their needs when it comes to engineering change management; describe it to the rest of the team and together find suitable solutions. It also includes testing, preparing education material and user instructions. As a Product owner/Business IT Analyst you will get great knowledge about our IT systems and how they relate to the product development process at Scania. The product owner is ensuring that the team backlog is aligned with customer and stakeholder needs.
   

  

 You will be a part of a cross-functional team with other Business IT Analysts, Developers, Product owners, Scrum masters and System architects etc. You will work closely with the people in business, system suppliers and your own team and other value creation teams. We are working in an agile way and plan our work together in ten weeks periods.
   

  

**Your profile**
 You are curious to understand the users behind the outspoken need. You have good communication skills, in both Swedish and English. You need to have ability to explain the user demands to the developers, visualise and document the needs, create working methods, training material as well as user guides. It is valuable to have a helpful and proactive mindset, an ability to see the big picture and also to understand the different mechanisms that create the full solution for the users. You have analytic way of thinking, to find solutions that are best for the users as well as the maintainability of the system. It is also appreciated to question old truths in order to find new, better ways of working. We want you to drive things forward in a smooth way and enjoy co-operating with others.
   

  

 You have a bachelor’s or master’s degree in Engineering, IT or Business. It is an advantage if you are familiar with the product development process and PLM/CAD systems (3DX from DS), especially from Scania. It is great if you have experience in the Product owner and Business Analyst role as well as agile way of working.
   

  

**Additional Information**
 As an employee at Scania, in addition to career development, we also provide wellness allowance, company car, insurance, job express to Södertälje headquarters in around 30 mins from Stockholm Central or Liljeholmen exclusively for Scania employees, and subsidized lunch.
   

  

 We are sitting in nice newly renovated activity based office. We have possibility to work from home some days in a week if the work allows. We offer an inclusive workplace with people with different skills and background and with possibilities to personal development. The work/life balance is important for us.
   

  

**Further information**
 If you have questions, please contact Anne Thomasfolk (Head of CAD/vPDM, EYMDD) +46 73 655 2685.
   

  

**Application**
 Please send in your CV, letter and grade copies latest 2024-07-07. We will start to call for interviews before end of application date and interviews will be held continuously. We use logic and personality tests in our selection process and background control will be made for final candidates.
   

  

 Do you want to join us and be one of us in our Value creation team? I´m looking forward to hear from you!
   

  

 Scania is a world-leading provider of transport solutions. Together with our partners and customers we are driving the shift towards a sustainable transport system. In 2020, we delivered 66,900 trucks, 5,200 buses as well as 11,000 industrial and marine power systems to our customers. Net sales totalled to over SEK 125 billion, of which over 20 percent were services-related. Founded in 1891, Scania now operates in more than 100 countries and employs some 50,000 people. Research and development are mainly concentrated in Sweden. Production takes place in Europe and Latin America with regional product centres in Africa, Asia and Eurasia. Scania is part of TRATON GROUP. For more information visit: www.scania.com.

title: Executive Assistant till Egon Zehnder
description:
**Vill du bli en del av ett familjärt och högpresterande team där du ligger steget före och bidrar med det du är bäst på? Egon Zehnder söker nu en proaktiv Executive Assistant som är en stjärna på administration och som motiveras av att vara delaktig i projekt från start till mål.** 




  





**Om rollen** 




 Här får du en viktig och central roll där du ansvarar för att hålla ihop våra processer och föra arbetet framåt. Du är det administrativa navet i uppdragen som rör rekrytering och rådgivning inom ledarskap. En stor del av uppdragen inbegriper kollegor från andra kontor, vilket leder till kontinuerlig kontakt med såväl kollegor som klienter och kandidater internationellt.
 



  





 I rollen som Executive Assistant supporterar man två konsulter i deras uppdrag. Du är involverad i varje uppdrag och du blir involverad redan i offertstadie tills det att rekryteringen har gått i mål. Du har en viktig roll för att underlätta processerna och föra arbetet framåt. Dina ansvarsområden och arbetsuppgifter varierar men vanligt förekommande är:
 



  




* Ta fram, förbereda, korrekturläsa och distribuera projektrelaterade dokument så som presentationer inför pitchmöten, befattningsbeskrivningar, statusuppdateringar, kandidatpresentationer, referensrapporter. Material är väsentligen på engelska
* Kommunicera med inblandade i processerna, både internt och externt
* I tätt samarbete sköta konsulternas kalendrar i Outlook, samt e-postkorrespondens
* Sköta all mötesbokning, både för uppdrag och affärsutveckling, samt eventuella resor, taxi och hotell
* Registrering och uppdatering av information i olika system
* Löpande fakturahantering



  





 I rollen som Executive Assistant förväntas du ligga steget före, arbeta proaktivt och ha ett professionellt arbetssätt där du bidrar med support men även agerar som ett bollplank. Många situationer uppstår ad hoc som ofta måste lösas i princip direkt så det krävs ett positivt mindset och en ”can-do” attityd. I och med att man ofta arbetar internationellt kan det komma mail både på kvällar och helger så det måsta man kunna hantera i rollen som assistent.
 



  





**Vem söker vi?** 




 Vi söker dig som har minst fem års erfarenhet av en liknande roll där du tagit stort ansvar och arbetat med hög integritet och kvalitativ leverans. Kanske har du jobbat inom advokatbyrå, professional services, rådgivning eller liknande där man ofta arbetar i projektform. Det är en stor fördel om du drivit projekt tidigare då rollen är en viktig del i att driva vårt arbete framåt.
 



  





 Vi lägger stor vikt vid dina personliga egenskaper och söker dig som trivs i en professionell, högpresterande och öppen företagskultur.
 



  





 Vi ser att du är noggrann, strukturerad och duktig på att prioritera och planera din tid. Vidare är du van att arbeta i högt tempo och har förmågan att hålla dig lugn även i mer pressade situationer. Du bör ha en stor förståelse för komplexiteten i uppdragen samt stor vana vid att hantera skriftlig dokumentation och kommunikation. Du har hög integritet, diskretion och uppskattar och föredrar arbete som sker i nära samarbete med andra, där varje person bidrar till helheten.
 



  





 Du är flytande i svenska och affärsengelska i tal och skrift. Du är trygg i hela Officepaketet, speciellt Power Point och Word och du har en god förståelse för IT.
 



  





**Om Egon Zehnder** 




 Egon Zehnder har varit verksamma i Sverige sedan slutet av 1960-talet och finns i Stockholm och Malmö. Vi arbetar över alla branscher och ger råd till både globala företag och lokala kunder kring deras viktigaste ledarskapsutmaningar. Vår kundbas sträcker sig från börsnoterade och etablerade familje-företag till investerings- och private equity-bolag, tech-scaleups, statliga institutioner och ideella organisationer.
 



  





 Som pionjärer inom rekrytering & rådgivning inom ledarskap i världen bygger vår verksamhet på en stark tradition av att vara marknadsledande och den pålitliga rådgivaren i en snabb och föränderliga affärsmiljö. Som ett resultat av vårt innovativa tankesätt har vi utvecklat flera nya tjänster. Egon Zehnder finns globalt på 60+ kontor i 36 länder runt om i världen och det är ett stort inslag av samarbete mellan kontoren.
 



  





**Vad erbjuder vi dig?** 




 Vi erbjuder en professionell och familjär kultur där vi vill att man ska trivas och stanna länge. Vi är partnerägda och har en platt organisation där vi bryr oss om varandra och gillar att göra saker ihop. Vi erbjuder en professionell miljö där din roll gör skillnad då vi har ett tätt samarbete i varje uppdrag.
 



  





 Vi är ett team på 23 kollegor i Sverige och har ett nära samarbete med våra kollegor i övriga världen. 600+ konsulter globalt, och totalt drygt 2 000 anställda. Huvudkontor i Schweiz.
 



  





**Mer om tjänsten:** 




 I den här rekryteringen samarbetar Egon Zehnder med OnePartnerGroup Stockholm. Tjänsten är på heltid med start enligt överenskommelse och du kommer att ha din arbetsplats på Blasieholmsgatan 5 i Stockholm. Här råder en flexibilitet där du har möjlighet att jobba hemma någon dag i veckan men vi ser gärna att du gillar att vara på kontoret då vi har en familjär och härlig kultur som vi är måna om.
 



  





 Har du frågor om tjänsten eller undrar hur processen ser ut framöver är du välkommen att kontakta ansvariga rekryteringskonsulter Christina Stenbeck på christina.stenbeck@onepartnergroup.se eller Marie Bodén på marie.boden@onepartnergroup.se
 



  





 Vänta inte med att skicka in din ansökan då vi går igenom kandidater löpande och tjänsten kan komma att tillsättas före sista ansökningsdatum. Vi tar inte emot ansökningarna via mail. Om du går vidare i processen kommer du att få genomföra två arbetspsykologiska tester för att vi ska kunna göra den bästa matchningen av kandidater.
 



  





 Vi ser fram emot att höra från dig!

title: Paid Social Specialist
description:
*Publicis Groupe is one of the largest communications groups in the world. We are building the agency model of the future and take a holistic approach to our clients’ challenges. By fusing together our media, creative, data and technology expertise, we are able to provide clients with integrated solutions, transformative ideas and compelling consumer experiences. We call it the Power of One.* 




*We are proud winner of many awards and nominations, both in Sweden and internationally. But nothing makes us prouder than to work with clients and brands such as Disney, Elgiganten, Mondelez, Essity, Volvo, VISA, Lantmännen, Nomad Foods, Lactalis, Midsona, Renault and many more.* 




*At Publicis, we put our people first. We are proud to be certified by Great Place to Work (2022, 2023, 2024), and have been recognized with a Magnet Award for our engaging culture (2023). Our goal is to become the leading workplace in our industry. We are based in a fantastic office in Odenplan, but also offer a flexible work policy.*



**Job Description**

 We are currently seeking talent for the Paid Social team. As a specialist, you will work alongside project managers and digital planners to execute results-driven campaigns on various social media channels such as Facebook, Instagram, Snapchat, TikTok, Pinterest, and others. Your ongoing tasks will include social media purchases; ranging from recommendations, campaign setups, campaign optimization, campaign analysis, and reporting.
 



 As a Paid Social Specialist, you will be responsible for the following areas:
 


* Creating and implementing tactical campaign recommendations within paid social.
* Planning, purchasing, optimizing, and regularly reporting social media campaigns.
* Handling campaigns practically via self-service tools including purchasing, optimization, and campaign management.
* Constantly analyzing and evaluating campaign results based on set goals.
* Various administrative tasks related to campaigns and customer work.


**Qualifications**
* Academic or relevant post-secondary education.
* You are communicative, fluent in both Swedish and English, have a strong sense of service, and thoroughly enjoy yourrole as a consultant.
* You are curious and proactive with high accuracy and analytical ability.
* You are technically inclined and have an easy time learning to work in different systems.
* You enjoy working independently, in a structured manner, and adhere to set timelines.
* You are solution-oriented and are not afraid to work with new methods to achieve set goals.


**Additional Information**

 In addition to a welcoming culture and inclusive environment with passionate colleagues we offer you:
 


* **Career Opportunities**



 Local and Global opportunities through the Power Of One.
 


* **Personal and Professional Learning**



 Global AI learning platform where you can participate in +30 000 classes and connect with colleagues from all over the world.
 


* **Flexible Ways of Working**



 We want to be an employer where work life balance is cherished. We love to spend time with our colleagues at the office but also believe in the output of your work not where the work is being done.
 


* **Work Your World**



 For six weeks a year, the world is yours. Every employee can work anywhere on the planet where there's a Publicis office. A new city, a favorite locale, or even a different country - Go. Grow. Explore.
 


* **Mental Health**



 The happiness and health of our people is paramount to us. We work continuously on maintaining a healthy and safe working environment through initiatives that facilitate the well-being of our employees.
 


* **Benefits**



 Generous benefit package.

title: Partner Manager Nordics
description:
As our Nordic Partner Manager, you will be a key player in Voyado's expansion by using your relationship-building and business skills to grow our partner network. You will be responsible for our Partners, both on the service and technology side. Together with our partner team, you will drive our network of existing partners to outstanding co-sell opportunities and find new relevant companies to join forces with.
 



 Your primary focus will be to recruit, onboard, and scale partners. This includes sales training, evaluation of sales opportunities via partners, and setting up business plans for new partner integrations. This is a great opportunity to develop professionally and influence Voyado’s growth strategy!
   




 So, who are you?
   


 A social chameleon who treats the delicate task of serving the few with the most exclusive relationships and at the same time manages to give the many a baseline treatment. You like to think strategically, but act hands-on and get things done. You are an entrepreneurial person with a business mindset who likes to create business opportunities. You are genuinely interested in the tech landscape around online retail and constantly seek inspiration and knowledge that you can apply in your own work.
   





*Skills & Background:* 



* Bachelor’s degree in Engineering, Marketing, Communication or Economics
* Several years of experience of partner management, account management, or B2B sales within the SaaS industry, preferably within retail or e-commerce
* Ability to be your own Project manager, setting your local plan and knowing how to prioritize to achieve key targets.
* You like the idea of end-customer sales but do not necessarily need to go the whole way to closing the deal
* A plus is if you not only are tech-curious but also have some insight into technical integration projects or setup of SaaS platforms
* For this role, you need to be fluent in English and Swedish. Knowledge in Norwegian and/or Danish is highly meritorious



 Traveling every second week and evening representation in the local markets of Denmark and Norway is required for this role.
   




 What we offer
   


 You will be part of an extremely exciting journey in redesigning the market for personalized customer experiences. We want to make our products Europe's leading customer experience cloud in retail and e-commerce, and together with our customers, we are well on our way. We are extremely dedicated to the task, but at the same time, we ensure that everyone is doing well at work. You will have plenty of room to grow in a creative work environment where personal development is as obvious as high competence. You get to work with some of the strongest brands across the Nordics who use Voyado as a platform for their loyalty work, and your everyday life has elements of collaboration with both customer and internal Voyado teams.
 


 More on Voyado!
 
 Voyado is the ultimate solution for personalization and relevance across all channels—online and offline. Used by retailers and e-commerce companies worldwide, the Voyado customer experience cloud makes it possible for every brand to engage customers, elevate shopping experiences, and evolve their businesses.
   

  

 We are a Swedish purpose-driven company with 300+ Voyadoers where every opinion is recognized. Here, you'll get the opportunity to work self-driven with strong support that you can leverage at any time. We really care for our Voyadoers and put a lot of time and effort into keeping and nurturing our knowledge-sharing and friendly culture. We are personal and that extends into everything about Voyado, read more on what it is like to work at Voyado here.
   




 Ready to join the team?
 
 Lovely! Applying is super easy. Use your LinkedIn profile (or upload a resume) and answer a few click-in questions (no data entry, we promise). We´d love to get to know you and understand what makes you tick, so write a few lines about what you enjoy about your role and what would be an exciting challenge for you going forward. We are eager to get to know you and what you love to do, so be yourself and let that shine through in your application!
   




 Additional information
   


 As part of our recruitment process we conduct a background check on the final candidate. We use background checks from Scandinavian Recruitment Intelligence. Here you can read more about how a background check is done.

title: Managing Director, Trilogy (Remote) - $400,000/year USD
description:
Crossover is the world's #1 source of full-time remote jobs. Our clients offer top-tier pay for top-tier talent. We're recruiting this role for our client, Trilogy. Have you got what it takes?
   

  

 If you think most CEOs are full of themselves (and full of other stuff)... keep reading.
   

  

 Here’s a CEO track that requires — and actually rewards — zero experience being a CEO. In this role, you’ll become an incredibly effective, customer-facing CEO in an environment with more than 100 software products.
   

  

 Who You Are
   

  

 You’ve never been a CEO before. Probably because most of the time, “CEO” is just a 3-letter code for “an exhausting hamster wheel of team building and internal operations logistics.” And hopping on that hamster wheel would be a huge waste of your talent and potential.
   

  

 You’re smart. You keep things clear and direct. And while you’ve worked in SaaS for many years, you don’t have a decade of outdated “leadership” learnings to unlearn. You’re ready to be the leader that smart employees like you have been waiting for. This job right here is your launchpad.
   

  

 You're a generative AI power user. You've used ChatGPT, Claude, Bard, or a similar tool to automate previously manual workflows (note: this role does not require a software development background).
   

  

 You should already be well on your way to building a strong personal brand. We believe in the importance of a personal brand, and we’ll help you develop yours. You should understand the benefits and impact of a personal brand, the long-tail nature of content, and the effort it takes.
   

  

 You have experience with quickly moving products, particularly in leadership roles during the launch of epic new features. If you’ve been part of teams going from Seed through Series A/B rounds, that’s a huge plus. You’ve got proven ability to get customers excited about new product features and have used metrics like net dollar retention and win-back rates (and others) to measure the impact of new product features.
   

  

**What You Will Be Doing**
* Implementing AI-driven Productivity Improvements: Utilizing generative AI tools to streamline and automate various workflows across the company.
* Customer Engagement and Feedback: Interacting with customers to gather insights and feedback, and using this information to enhance product offerings.
* Develop a Personal Monopoly: Publishing podcast episodes and blog posts and building a social media following to evangelize your portfolio's AI-driven products.


**What You Won’t Be Doing**
* Busywork that drains your creativity.
* Day-in, day-out team management or internal operations that distract from your vision.
* Tinker with the business model to figure out what works. (Remember, we’re giving you the playbook.)


**Basic Requirements**
**Managing Director key responsibilities**
* At least 8 years of work experience in the enterprise software industry
* Leadership experience in marketing, sales, business development, partnerships, professional services, or another hands-on customer-facing domain
* Experience using generative AI tools to achieve quantifiable productivity improvements
* Currently based in North America, South America, or Europe


**About Trilogy**
 Hundreds of software businesses run on the Trilogy Business Platform. For three decades, Trilogy has been known for 3 things: Relentlessly seeking top talent, Innovating new technology, and incubating new businesses. Our technological innovation is spearheaded by a passion for simple customer-facing designs. Our incubation of new businesses ranges from entirely new moon-shot ideas to rearchitecting existing projects for today's modern cloud-based stack. Trilogy is a place where you can be surrounded with great people, be proud of doing great work, and grow your career by leaps and bounds.
   

  

 There is so much to cover for this exciting role, and space here is limited. Hit the Apply button if you found this interesting and want to learn more. We look forward to meeting you!
   

  

**Working with Crossover**
 This is a full-time (40 hours per week), long-term position. The position is immediately available and requires entering into an independent contractor agreement with Crossover. The compensation level for this role is $200 USD/hour, which equates to $400,000 USD/year assuming 40 hours per week and 50 weeks per year. The payment period is weekly. Consult www.crossover.com/help-and-faqs for more details on this topic.
   

  

**What to expect next:**
* You will receive an email with a link to start your self-paced, online job application.
* Our hiring platform will guide you through a series of online “screening” assessments to check for basic job fit, job-related skills, and finally a few real-world job-specific assignments.


**Important!** 
 If you do not receive an email from us:
   

  

* First, emails may take up to 15 minutes to send, refresh and check again.
* Second, check your spam and junk folders for an email from Crossover.com, mark as “Not Spam” since you will receive other emails as well.
* Third, we will send to whatever email account you indicated on the Apply form - by default, that is the email address you use as your LinkedIn username and it might be different than the one you have already checked.
* If all else fails, just reset your password by visiting https://www.crossover.com/auth/password-recovery if you already applied using LinkedIn EasyApply.


 Crossover Job Code: LJ-4649-SE-Stockhol-ManagingDirect.002

title: BUSINESS CONTROLLER EUROBONUS
description:
**Business Controller EuroBonus - Loyalty Program**
 The thrill never ends! Do you want to embark on an exciting journey and work with developing one of Scandinavia’s strongest Loyalty Programs? Do you want to be a key player in ensuring a cost-efficient operation and improved financial performance? Do you like being proactive and learning the ins and outs of a complex business and in return being awarded a lot of responsibility? If so, come join our business controller team!
   

  

 As business controller, you will be responsible for developing and driving the financial agenda of the loyalty program department (i.e the Eurobonus program) and the marketing or sales department. You will have one foot in finance and the other foot in the business and together program management strive for continuous improvements and ensuring fulfillment of Eurobonus’, and ultimately SAS’, strategy. You support the business unit as an integral part in the unit’s strategy execution, mainly focusing on financial performance, planning and follow up as well as supporting in cost saving initiatives, efficiency projects and business development. Except from building and maintaining a close relationship with key business stakeholders, you will also work within a team of other business controllers.
   

  

 Your responsibility and involvement will also include storytelling in numbers and improving financial transparency within the unit as well as to other stakeholders within Finance as well as other areas. You should reinforce financial awareness in the business unit, assuring control, transparency, accuracy, predictability, and robustness with regards to financial performance (including capital expenditure, customer point liability, cash flow as well as P&L efficiency).
   

  

**Main Tasks**
* Act as a business partner to key business stakeholders within on all matters linked to financial performance and consequences. Be supportive as well as challenging.
* Proactively identify, assess, present and support in key business improvement opportunities.
* Benchmark, drive change and continue cost efficiency optimization.
* Follow up on performance/forecasts and other KPIs and assist in target setting.
* Support in negotiations with suppliers etc. to ensure financial quality and efficiency.
* Assist in setting a “know your number culture” in the units to ensure a good financial understanding amongst the relevant line managers.
* Responsible for the unit’s periodic management reporting, budget and forecast processes both for Profit and Loss statements as well as cash flow.
* Support with Ad-hoc analysis both locally, for the business units and centrally, for Business Performance Management (within Finance).


**Your Background & Skills**
* Solid experience in understanding business control, financial planning and analysis.
* A minimum 2 years working experience as business controller or other similar/relevant positions (prior experience from auditing or management consulting firm meriting).
* Experience from working as a business partner and driving the financial agenda in management teams.
* Experience of stakeholder management and cross functional leadership in a multinational environment.
* Experience from an operational environment or complex entities with complex planning processes is desired.
* Very good communication/presentation skills and ability to effectively convey a financial message.
* A strong challenging mindset and an innovative approach.
* Possess a strong self-drive and motivation to constantly improve and reach new goals.
* Relevant University degree within economy or finance, preferably on Master level.
* IT – Excellent skills in MS Excel (VBA macro knowledge meriting) and MS PowerPoint. MS PowerBI (or other Business Intelligence tool) experience highly desired.
* SQL experience is not required but a merit
* Fluency in English and preferably also one Scandinavian language


**Other Of Importance**
 As a person we believe you like to be intellectually and personally challenged and have an eagerness for continuous personal and professional development. You are a person who enjoys getting things done with a can-do attitude.
   

  

 You have a strong desire to improve the competitive position of SAS and Eurobonus. You also have a belief that collaboration with people in other organizational units is the key to delivering tangible and lasting results. The ability to relate to, manage and analyze complex financial material while relating to SAS overall strategic direction comes naturally to you. In addition, you are able to challenge and drive performance in a constructive manner whilst having a pedagogic mindset with excellent communication skills and ability to tailor message to audience.
   

  

**Is this you? If so, come fly with us!**
 This is a fulltime assignment based in Stockholm and you will report to Head of Business Control within the performance management team (Finance) but with dotted line to relevant supported business management team(s). If you feel your experience, skills and ambitions are right for this role, please apply as soon as possible with your CV and a short personal letter.
   

  

 For more information, contact Ida Moflag Pawlak, Head of Business Control Commercial and Digital & IT by email: ida.moflag (at) sas.se
   

  

 We look forward to hear from you!
   

  

**SAS**
 SAS, Scandinavia’s leading airline, with main hubs in Copenhagen, Oslo and Stockholm, flies to destinations in Europe, USA and Asia. Spurred by a Scandinavian heritage and sustainability values, SAS aims to be the global leader in sustainable aviation. We will reduce total carbon emissions 25 percent by 2025, by using more sustainable aviation fuel and our modern fleet with fuel-efficient aircraft. In addition to flight operations, SAS offers ground handling services, technical maintenance and air cargo services. SAS is a founding member of the Star Alliance™, and together with its partner airlines offers a wide network worldwide.

title: Sourcing & Vendor Manager
description:
**Schibsted Media** 
 is about to establish an IT organisation that will be responsible for all IT services in the new company. We are both dependent on highly skilled coworkers, as well as having excellent collaboration with the best vendors and partners.
   

  

 We are now looking for a
 **Sourcing & Vendor Manager** 
 that will play a key role in the success of Schibsted Media Tech, optimising procurement and vendor relationships for the entire Tech organisation.
   

  

 You will be part of the Media IT CIO office, report directly to the CIO and initially have one sourcing & vendor specialist reporting to you.
   

  

**What will you do in this role?**
 You will provide expertise, guidelines and hand on work with procurement, sourcing and vendor management for the Media Tech organisation. During the TSA period you will support Media Tech to enable the carve out of the existing services, as well as setting up new in accordance with Schibsted Media's future business needs.
   

  

**As a Sourcing & Vendor Manager, your responsibilities will include:**
* People management, initially for one sourcing and vendor specialist
* Developing and implementing strategies for sourcing Tech and IT services and products, ensuring alignment with organisational objectives
* Managing and optimising relationships with key Tech and IT vendors, negotiating contracts to achieve favourable terms and ensure service quality
* Collaborating with other teams within Tech and IT and business leaders to understand their needs and ensure vendor services meet these requirements
* Contract management processes including a process for how to handle all types of Tech and IT contracts (not only with strategic vendors)
* Overseeing the procurement process, from vendor selection and contract negotiation to performance monitoring and relationship management
* Conducting market analysis to stay informed of industry trends and identify opportunities for cost savings and innovation


**Key competencies:**
* Proven experience in Tech and IT procurement, sourcing, and vendor management, with a strong understanding of the market and trends
* Excellent negotiation skills, with a track record of securing favourable terms and managing contracts effectively
* Strong analytical and strategic thinking capabilities, able to assess vendors and products to make informed decisions that align with business goals
* Outstanding communication and interpersonal skills, capable of building and maintaining strong relationships with both vendors and internal stakeholders
* Ability to work collaboratively across departments, fostering a cooperative environment that encourages innovation in procurement processes


**“Nice to have”:**
* Experience with digital transformation projects and product development, understanding the procurement needs associated with new technologies and systems
* Familiarity with the Tech landscape in Oslo/Stockholm, including local vendors and market dynamics
* Certifications in procurement or supply chain management
* Experience in Media, with a deep understanding of the specific challenges and opportunities present

title: Försvarsmakten söker en svensk representant till NATO CCDCOE
description:
Försvarsmakten söker en svensk representant till NATO Cyber Defence Centre of Excellence,
   

  

 CCDCOE, i Tallinn med start sommaren/hösten 2025. Uppdraget är tidsbegränsad till 2 år, med möjlighet till förlängning med ytterligare 1 år.
   

  

 CCDCOE bildades 2008 efter att Estland utsatts för cyberattacker som påverkade åtkomsten till centrala IT-system. Centrumet är ett av Nato ackrediterat kunskapscentrum och består idag av 39 nationer från Natos medlems- och partnerländer. Det har ca 70 medarbetare. Sverige är medlem sedan 2017 och har en representant på plats sedan 2016.
   

  

 Centret har följande fokusområden; teknik,operationskonst, juridik och strategi. Centret ligger inte under Nato-kommando och personalen kan därför inte kallas in i händelse av höjd beredskap.
   

  

 Viktiga delar av verksamheten är; informationsspridning inom området, den årliga övningen ”Locked Shields“ där deltagande lag försvarar ett fiktivt land från cyberangrepp, cyberförsvarskonferensen ”CyCon“ med runt 600 deltagare samt forskning och utbildning. Bland centrets publikationer är ”Tallinnmanualen“ mest känd. Den avser tillämpning av internationell rätt på cyberoperationer och är ett viktigt referensverk på området. Ytterligare information om verksamheten finns på ”ccdcoe.org“.
   

  

 Till centret söks nu en person för tidsbegränsat uppdrag på heltid under två-tre år med placering i Tallin. Uppdraget arbetsleds av centret och inriktas av Försvarsmakten. I arbetet ingår att genomföra forskningsuppdrag, expertstöd till Nato och centrets medlemsländer, arbete med konferenser, utbildning, övningar samt att underhålla kontaktnät med svenska myndigheter.
   

  

**Kvalifikationer**
* Akademisk examen samt flerårig arbetslivserfarenhet relaterad till något av centrats arbetsområden.
* Goda kunskaper inom cybersäkerhet.
* Specialisering inom ett av centrets områden; teknik, operationskonst, juridik, strategi eller


 utbildningsadministration.
   

  

* Goda kunskaper om svenskt myndighetsväsen.
* Vana vid att skriva rapporter på akademisk nivå på engelska.
* Vana vid såväl självständigt arbete som i grupp i internationell miljö
* Mycket goda kunskaper i svenska och engelska, både i tal och i skrift.
* Initiativförmåga, god kommunikatör och bra på att underhålla ett kontaktnät.
* Vana vid att tala inför större publik och vid att undervisa.
* Svensk medborgare.


**Meriterande**
* Fullgjord värnplikt alternativt grundläggande militär utbildning.
* Goda kunskaper om Försvarsmakten.
* Goda kunskaper om Nato.
* Kunskaper i estniska och generella kunskaper om Estland.


**Övrigt**
 Urval av CV kommer att stämmas av med CCDCOE för att tillse att de passar in i centrets kompetensbehov. Intervjuer kommer genomföras av Försvarsmakten och därefter för utvald kandidat på plats i Tallinn. Säkerhetsprövning med separat intervju kommer att ske innan
   

  

 kontrakt skrivs. Förmåner enligt statligt utrikes tjänsteavtal, sk URA-avtal. I det ingår möjlighet till ersättning för bostad i Tallinn, en fri hemresa per år, möjlighet till veckopendling om familjen är kvar i Sverige alternativt viss ersättning till medföljande och möjlighet till skolgång för barn i internationell skola. Beskattning sker i Sverige och lön betalas i svenska kronor. Upplysningar om befattning lämnas av Christofer Flygare, 072 155 9313.
   

  

**Fackliga representanter**
 OFR/S Kjell Tetzlaff, SACO Camilla Robertsson,SEKO Lise-Lotte Larsson
   

  

 OFR/O Arne Nilsson.Samtliga nås via växel .
   

  

 Välkommen med din ansökan, CV samt ett personligt brev senast den
 **2024-08-18** 
 Mejla ansökan till , ange referens 736053.
   

  

* Information om Försvarsmakten och det rekryterande förbandet: I Högkvarteret (HKV) finns överbefälhavaren (ÖB) och generaldirektören (GD), vilka för närvarande har ungefär 1 000 medarbetare – både yrkesofficerare och civila experter. Högkvarteret utgörs av ledningsstaben, produktionsledningen, insatsledningen och militära underrättelse- och säkerhetstjänsten. I ledningsstaben ingår bland annat ekonomidirektören, personaldirektören, kommunikationsdirektören och chefsjuristen. Varje dag och varje timme gör våra medarbetare insatser som påverkar andra människors liv, både i stort och smått, och både på hemmaplan och runt om i världen. Försvarsmakten ger dig möjlighet att utvecklas som människa och växa i din professionella roll. Vi är en ansvarstagande arbetsgivare och har en öppen organisation där vi ställer upp för varandra. I Försvarsmakten finns en stark värdegrund som bygger på öppenhet, resultat och ansvar. Professionell utveckling och personlig hälsa värdesätts och uppmuntras. Det finns goda förutsättningar för intern karriärrörlighet, friskvård och bra balans mellan arbete och privatliv. Försvarsmakten tillvaratar de kvaliteter som mångfald och jämn könsfördelning tillför verksamheten. Vi välkomnar därför sökanden med olika bakgrund och erfarenheter i våra rekryteringar. En anställning hos oss innebär placering i säkerhetsklass. Vanligtvis krävs svenskt medborgarskap. Säkerhetsprövning med registerkontroll kommer att genomföras före anställning enligt 3 kap i säkerhetsskyddslagen. Med anställning följer en skyldighet att krigsplaceras. I anställningen ingår även en skyldighet att tjänstgöra utomlands. Innebörden av detta varierar beroende på typ av befattning. Till ansökan om anställning ska CV och personligt brev bifogas. Om du går vidare i anställningsprocessen ska alltid vidimerade kopior av betyg och intyg uppvisas. Samtal från externa rekryteringsföretag och säljare undanbedes.

title: Associate Asset Manager
description:
Om tjänsten
   

  

**Do you want to make impact on the energy transition with your result orientated and commercial mindset and interest in asset management and offshore wind? We look forward to get in touch when you want to be part of our mission and help us to achieve our goal of being fossil free within one generation!**
 Our Business Area Wind is responsible for Vattenfall’s Onshore and Offshore Wind as well as other renewable activities such as solar PV and batteries. Today we develop, construct and operate wind generation in Sweden, Denmark, Germany, the Netherlands and the UK.
   

  

 We are looking for a pro-active Associate Asset Manager to work on our growing pipeline and asset base of Offshore projects. In this role you will help shape the development of our asset management process in our offshore business, which will be instrumental to ensuring we preserve and drive value from our operational asset base in a complex regulatory landscape and maturing industry.
   

  

**Your Tasks And Responsibilities**
 As an Associate Asset Manager you will be part of the Asset Management and OMA team sitting within the Commercial and Asset Management function within Offshore. The Asset Management and OMA team is a commercial team that delivers end-to-end value for Vattenfall's offshore wind assets. It is responsible for delivering effective partnerships, asset management and managing revenue and risk for offshore wind projects across Northern Europe, including the UK.
   

  

 Your responsibilities as Associate Asset Manager can be described as following:
   

  

* Ensuring that the asset management plans to end of life are in place that will form the basis of the business plan for BU Offshore
* Help drive analyses for decisions related to key strategic commercial and technical decisions for the asset drawing on the input and diverse skill set of the BU offshore organisation
* Support in risk and opportunity management activities on applicable assets via proactive identification and quantification and management of both mitigation and implementation plans
* Work with a wide range of BU Offshore stakeholders
* Support in developing decision proposals to senior management
* Contribute to the management of contractual obligations and drive value from the operations and maintenance agreements (OMA) with exposure to joint venture partners
* Manage compliance overview for the asset under management.


**Location**
 The location of this position is flexible, and can be based in one of our core locations; London, Hamburg, Amsterdam, Kolding and Stockholm.
   

  

 Din bakgrund
   

  

**Who are you?**
 For this position we are looking for an energetic new colleague bringing profound understanding of the intriguing tasks and the ability to work autonomously with precision. As well as being a genuine team player, with the ability to influence over a wide network of co-worker relationships and key stakeholders.
   

  

 Also, you bring the following qualifications:
   

  

* An economics, mathematics, law, technical, commercial and/or scientifical qualification to graduate level or equivalent
* Some knowledge and experience of risk management principles and application desirable
* Candidates should have an understanding of business case drivers and commercial opportunities
* Experience of working in renewables, oil and gas, or similar complex industries is desirable.


 You bring the following key competencies:
   

  

* Possess excellent organizational skills and be comfortable at simultaneously managing several tasks to often challenging deadlines
* Positive mindset with strong self-motivation, resilience, and both a flexible and proactive approach to tackling problems.
* Strong communication skills at all levels within the organization, including proactive sharing of any new ideas or thoughts.
* The ability to work within a diverse working environment.
* Enjoy working in international, multidisciplinary projects and teams and you are willing to travel.
* Excellent written and spoken English is a key requirement as well as the ability to use MS Office, in particular MS Excel and PowerPoint.


 Mer information
   

  

**Our offer**
 We offer you a challenging and independent job in an informal international working environment. You will work in interdisciplinary teams and can always count on support from committed colleagues as “Ask and Share” concept is essential for the way we work. We offer attractive employment conditions and opportunities for personal and professional development.
   

  

**More Information**
 We welcome your application in English, as soon as possible for you and as long the vacancy is published here online. We kindly request that you do not send applications by any means other than via our website as we cannot guarantee that we will be able to process applications that are not made via our website.
   

  

 For more information about the recruitment process you are welcome to contact our recruiter Jurriaan Rang via jurriaan.rang@vattenfall.com
   

  

 At Vattenfall we are convinced that diversity contributes to build a more profitable and attractive company and we strive to be good role model regarding diversity. Vattenfall works actively for all employees to have the same opportunities and rights regardless of gender, ethnicity, age, transgender identity or expression, religion or other belief, disability or sexual orientation.
   

  

**We look forward to receiving your application!**
 Om oss
   

  

 Vattenfall is a European energy company with approximately 20 000 employees. For more than 100 years we have electrified industries, supplied energy to people’s homes and modernized our way of living through innovation and cooperation. We now want to make fossil-free living possible within one generation. To be able to reach this ambitious goal we are looking for talented individuals who, in addition to their passion for their own role, also have strong team spirit and want to contribute to supporting a meaningful corporate mission.

title: Gruppchef inom kraftsystem med fokus på Operation & Control
description:
**Gruppchef inom kraftsystem med fokus på Operation & Control till Stockholm**
 Lockas du av tanken att förflytta energibranschen i en hållbar riktning genom förstklassiga lösningar inom driftnära IT? Är du övertygad om att det görs bäst genom nära kundrelationer kombinerat med styrkan i ett riktigt bra ledarskap? Då kanske det är just Dig vi söker!
   

  

**Varför jobba hos oss?**
 Swecos experter inom energi och industri är ledande inom Norden och hjälper både företag och organisationer att utveckla en kostnadseffektiv och miljömässigt hållbar energiförsörjning. Energiverksamheten inom region Power Systems består av åtta grupper med ledande kompetens inom kraftsystem/elkraft där tre av dessa har fokus på driftnära IT (Operation and Control). Till en av grupperna i Mälardalen söker vi nu en gruppchef med uppgift att leda och vidareutveckla verksamheten.
   

  

 Gruppen arbetar med driftnära IT och kombinerar kompetens inom elkraft, verksamhetsförståelse i kombination med god IT-kompetens. Bland annat finns kompetenser inom projektledning, upphandling, styrning och övervakning av elnät, IT-arkitektur, operation technology, informations- och cybersäkerhet samt data science.
   

  

 Med utgångspunkt i Swecos marknadsledande position inom kraftsystem/elkraft kommer du i denna roll att vara med om en mycket spännande resa med att skapa förutsättningar för en nödvändig omställning och utveckling av kraftsystemet.
   

  

 Som chef hos oss står du inte ensam. På Sweco blir du en del av en gemenskap. I våra relationer till varandra och till våra kunder hittar vi styrkan, nyfikenheten och lösningarna att komma framåt – både i jobbet och i livet. Vi är en flexibel arbetsplats för att du ska kunna styra dina dagar i största möjliga mån, genom ansvar, frihet och stöttande kollegor. Hos oss är det viktigt att ha kul på jobbet!
   

  

**Din framtida roll**
 I din roll som gruppchef ingår att
   

  

* Vara en närvarande ledare som coachar och stöttar utvecklingen av gruppen
* Ha medarbetaransvar för gruppens medarbetare
* Leda och utveckla verksamheten och våra tjänster på en växande marknad
* Samarbeta tätt med de andra grupperna inom Power Systems, samt övriga affärsenheter inom Energi- och industridivisionen
* Ha goda kundkontakter och se till att kontinuerligt stärka gruppens leveransförmåga
* Ha ett affärs- och resultatansvar för gruppen
* Som en del av regionens ledningsgrupp bidra till utvecklingen av Power Systems verksamhet i Sverige


**Dina erfarenheter**
 Vi söker dig som har
   

  

* Erfarenhet av en ledande befattning
* Erfarenhet från energibranschen
* En civilingenjörsexamen inom elkraft eller annan relevant utbildning med motsvarad förvärvad arbetslivserfarenhet
* Erfarenhet inom driftnära IT, kraftsystemanalys eller elnät och/eller konsultbranschen är meriterande


**Vem är du?**
 För den här rollen söker vi dig som är en relationsskapande ledare som involverar, engagerar och utvecklar andra. Du har ett coachande ledarskap och uppfattas som lyhörd, trygg och prestigelös. Du har förmågan att bygga framgångsrika team och motiveras av andras framgångar. Du är affärsmässig och ser det som en viktig del i ledarrollen att skapa tillväxt och lönsamhet.
   

  

**Ansökan**
 Annonsen kommer att ligga ute till och med den 30 september 2024. Intervjuer sker löpande och tjänsten kan tillsättas före sista ansökningsdatum. Vi tar inte emot ansökningar via mejl, utan hänvisar samtliga ansökningar till ansökningsformuläret nedan. Vi återkopplar till samtliga sökande efter avslutad rekryteringsprocess.
   

  

 Varmt välkommen med din ansökan!
   

  

 Bakgrundskontroller kommer att genomföras på slutkandidaten som del i denna rekryteringsprocess. Vi använder bakgrundskontroller från SRI. Här kan du läsa mer om hur en bakgrundskontroll går till Vanliga frågor och svar om bakgrundskontroller.
   

  

**Kontakt**
 Oskar Fängström, Regionchef Power Systems, oskar.d.fangstrom@sweco.se, 0703-86 34 70
   

  

 Susanne Davidson, Talent Acquistion, susanne.davidson@sweco.se
   

  

 På Sweco vill vi vara en arbetsplats präglad av mångfald. Vi tror att fler perspektiv breddar vår förmåga att fortsätta nå våra mål och eftersträvar mångfald i våra rekryteringsprocesser.
   

  

 Sweco planerar och utformar framtidens hållbara samhällen och städer. Tillsammans med våra kunder utvecklar våra 22 000 arkitekter, ingenjörer och andra experter lösningar för att hantera urbaniseringen, ta vara på digitaliseringens möjligheter och göra framtidens samhällen mer hållbara. Sweco är det ledande konsultföretaget inom teknik och arkitektur i Europa med en omsättning på cirka 29 miljarder SEK. Företaget är noterat på Nasdaq Stockholm. För ytterligare information, www.sweco.se

title: Säljande konsultchef / rekryteringskonsult
description:
Marknaden förändras snabbt och ställer oss ständigt inför nya utmaningar och möjligheter. Tech-talanger är efterfrågade. Men att hitta dem, matcha dem mot rätt möjligheter, testa deras färdigheter, utmana dem och ibland övertyga dem är en komplex process. Det är här du kommer in i bilden! Vi söker en Tech Talent Consultant & Business Manager till Amendo Tech i Stockholm.
   

  

**Arbetsbeskrivning**
 I rollen som Tech Talent Consultant & Business Manager (konsultchef/rekryteringskonsult) på Amendo Tech blir du en viktig länk i att forma framtidens arbetsliv och bidra till att företag och individer når sina mål. Du har ett stort eget ansvar för att kontakta och bygga relationer med kandidater och kunder inom Amendo Techs område, och kommer driva hela processen från annonsskrivning och intervju till anställning och uppföljning. En stor del av ditt arbete kommer vara att aktivt utveckla och underhålla ditt kandidat- och kundnätverk inom vårt område, samtidigt som du prioriterar att boka upp kundmöten och träffar proaktivt kunder för att hjälpa dem vid rekryterings- och/eller konsultbehov. Du kommer tilldelas ett antal befintliga kunder, men framför allt kommer ditt fokus ligga på att identifiera nya potentiella kunder och kontakter genom ihärdig, strukturerad och energisk kartläggning och bearbetning av marknaden.
   

  

**Kvalifikationer och egenskaper**
 Vi söker dig, som liksom vi, brinner för samspelet mellan människa, tech, kompetens och affär. Vi ser att du har ett stort nätverk av såväl kunder som kandidater samt är nyfiken och vill förstå våra kunders verksamhet. Du är passionerad och medkännande - och har en "det fixar vi-attityd”. Vidare älskar du att möta nya människor och att matcha kompetens med behov. Du gillar att ha många kontaktytor och dialoger igång samtidigt, är entreprenörsdriven och vill vara med och bygga upp ett bolag från grunden - vår resa har bara börjat. Sist men inte minst är du genuint sugen på att jobba med techrekrytering och konsulttjänster inom framför allt bank, finans och försäkring. Du känner dig bekväm att prata och skriva på såväl svenska som engelska.
   

  

 Vi tror att du antingen har varit konsultchef inom tech/IT eller jobbat minst ett par år med rekrytering inom området. Det är också värdefullt om du har egen konsulterfarenhet och ett genuint intresse samt förståelse för tech och kompetensen som skapar de magiska lösningarna.
   

  

**Vi erbjuder dig**
* att bli en del av Amendo Tech - en startup som ingår i Amendo Group, med över 20 års erfarenhet av att förse organisationer med högkvalitativ kompetens. Du blir en del av vår koncern och är med och bidrar till vår fortsatta tillväxt och framgång.
* kollektivavtal och en rad andra förmåner. Vi värdesätter våra medarbetares välmående och strävar efter att skapa en positiv och inkluderande arbetsmiljö.
* centralt läge i Stockholm med ett trevligt kontor att samlas på. Vi lever och andas digitalt så naturligtvis är vi även ett hybrid-kontor.
* mycket ansvar och frihet att strukturera ditt arbete och dina dagar på ett sätt som passar dig och verksamheten bäst. Vi tror på att ge våra medarbetare möjlighet att växa och utvecklas både professionellt och personligt, och vi stöder dig i att nå dina mål och förverkliga din fulla potential.


**Om Amendo Tech**
 Amendo Tech grundades 2022 för att möta det stora behov som finns inom den pågående digitala transformationen i näringslivet. Vi arbetar med konsulter/interim management och rekrytering/executive search inom tech, IT och digital utveckling. Följ oss gärna på Linkedin!
   

  

 Amendo Tech är en del av Amendo Group som har arbetat med kompetensförsörjning sedan 2001. I koncernen ingår även Amendo Bemanning & Rekrytering och Lagotto Executive Search & Interim. Hos oss finns en gemenskap – och passionerade samt engagerade individer som drivs av att göra skillnad. Vi kallar det tillsammansskap.
   

  

**Frågor och kontakt**
 Vill du veta mer om rollen eller om Amendo Tech? Hör av dig till mig, Johanna Hallenberg, på 076-024 62 40 eller johanna.hallenberg@amendotech.se. Då vi träffar kandidater löpande, och tjänsten kan komma att tillsättas innan sista ansökningsdatum, är du varmt välkommen att söka tjänsten så snart som möjligt. Vi ser fram emot din ansökan!
   

  

 #IT

title: Associate Product Marketing Manager
description:
**Juni who?** 
 👋
 



*We’re Juni. Born on the West Coast (of Sweden). Built for flexible working. And busy building a future where digital commerce is free from financial barriers. Want to be a part of it all?* 




  





**What We Do 🤔** 




 Juni gives online businesses the tools they need to save time, scale up and succeed. Our platform helps financial leaders take control of their cash flow, make better decisions and unlock the full potential of digital commerce. We even offer working capital to help them achieve their goals and dream up new ones. And that’s just for starters.
 



  





**How & why we do it** 
 🚀
 



 We give our people the same thing we’re building for our customers: freedom. Freedom to be 100% yourself. Freedom to explore your potential and what’s more – make the most of it. We truly believe we’re making the world a better place for online businesses, and we want you to be a part of that mission.
 



  





**Your role** 
 🙋
 



 As an Associate Product Marketing Manager at Juni, you will be a key facilitator of product and customer insights. Your role is crucial in ensuring that our product positioning, value propositions, competitor insights, market trends, product launches, and sales enablement are always strategically aligned and impactful. You will work closely with the Product, Commercial and Communications teams, requiring a blend of creative, strategic, and tactical skills.
 



 For a deeper understanding of Product Marketing, consider reading more here.
 



  





**Your responsibilities** 
 💪
 



  





**In This Role You’ll** 




 Be working with a wide range of stakeholders within Product, Commercial and Communications. As the marketing constituent you will own end-to-end launches of new products and key features, defining a tailored messaging strategy and bringing it to the team at Juni and to our customers.
 



  





**Within 1 Month You'll** 



* Successfully onboard and start getting to grips with Juni’s product suite, positioning and messaging.
* Build a relationship between product managers and marketing team stakeholders.



  





**Within 3 Months You'll** 



* Develop competitive positioning and feature-level comparison for established and emerging competitors in the market.
* Work with the marketing and brand teams to create assets and deliver integrated product marketing campaigns across owned, earned, and paid channels.
* Draw insights from our community of customers and apply that to Product Marketing practice.
* Have led your first product launch.



  





**Within 6 Months You'll** 



* Delivered best in class product marketing for product releases and demonstrated the successful impact they have had.
* Delivered your first internal training to internal stakeholders.
* Driven optimisation and automation in marketing together with Marketing- and RevOps teams.



  





**Your Qualifications 👨‍🎓** 




  





**What we need to see:** 



* Minimum 1-2 years experience within a B2B role (sales, marketing, product)
* Good stakeholder management and prioritization
* Previous experience working cross functionally between teams
* An inclination to data-lead decisions



  





**What We’d Love To See** 



* Previous experience with owning the end-to-end product launch and retrospective process harnessing learnings and improving efficiencies
* Ability to navigate through market product positioning and messaging nuances



  





**Your people** 
 👥
 



 We practice people-first culture. We’re real. We never wait. We care deeply about building a better future for our customers and each other. Here, you can work with people at the top of their game and who didn’t get there by playing games. You can help us create a whole new category in financial services.
 



  





**Your benefits** 
 😍
 



 We’re freedom-first. Transparent. Caring. Empowering. So our benefits are too.
 


* We work hybrid. We'll see you in one of our offices at least two days per week.
* Swap 2D for 3D. Meet all Junis IRL at the company onsite each year.
* Diversity is at our core. We're part Swedish. Part Canadian. Part French. Part Indian. Part Italian. Part British. Part Portuguese. You get the idea.
* Great players can stay great players. Progress your career whether you choose to manage people or not.
* Stock options. We can’t promise you’ll make a fortune. But we’ll give it our very best shot.
* Vacation days. 30 days contractually. Unlimited in policy. Awesome.
* Global health insurance. You know. Just in case. Therapy & massage included.
* Get sick? No stress. Feel better with unlimited paid sick leave.



  





**The process 📅** 




 CV screening > Get to know us call > Team interview(s) > Values interview > Offer (for some roles we’ll include a task, but we’ll notify you if this is the case)

title: 1st line Manager R&D Real Estate safety and security
description:
**Introduction**
***Are you passionate about leadership and development? Are you good at communicating and like to create a strong team spirit?***
***Then the role of head of R&D Real Estate safety and security is something for you?***
 Scania is now undergoing a transformation from being a supplier of trucks, buses and engines to a supplier of complete and sustainable transport solutions. Leading the change - Driving the shift - means that we are working on electrifying our range of vehicles.
   

  

 This will bring new work environment and safety risks. Within our group, we work to coordinate the safe operation and management of R&D's resources and processes, which includes electrical safety, fire safety, external environment/chemicals, work environment, physical safety and personnel safety. Part of our mission is also to support R&D with the safety and security culture.
   

  

**Main Mission**
 You will lead and develop a senior group where the majority of the team members are coordinators.
   

  

 The task is to work closely with the group to be able to understand and drive the group's issues at a strategic level within R&D.
   

  

 You will also be part of EMEC's management team and with your experience and knowledge we will together shape the strategy going forward for the entire section.
   

  

***Safety, health and working environment***
 SHE (Safety, health & environment)
   

  

 Develop and strengthen the safety culture for a safe and healthy workplace through cross-functional collaboration and engagement with stakeholders, towards our vision:
   

  

 Zero accidents & incidents where a world-class safety culture brings success
   

  

 Provide coaching and support in compliance with current health and safety legislation, policy and practices with stakeholders to ensure compliance with laws. Monitor, evaluate, identify areas for improvement and make recommendations. Support risk assessments, root cause analysis for accidents or incidents. Stay up to date with industry best practices and emerging trends.
   

  

***Security – Operational security (physical security, personnel security & information security)***
 Security – Protective Security (Physical Security, Personnel Security & Information Security)
   

  

 Is the second leg within the group, there your role will be to develop and support the work forward together with the employees in security (operational security) to strengthen the security culture throughout R&D in the areas of physical security and personnel security. The third domain within business protection at R&D is led from a group within the R&D sector EY. This means, together with that group, including information security in order to create comprehensive operational protection together with physical security and personnel security.
   

  

 Participate as an expert in operational security and within the responsibility as security manager for R&D in the RDSÄK forum, which is R&D's coordination forum for issues related to security (operational security).
   

  

**Your profile**
 We are looking for you who is a committed and experienced leader, to coach our group so that R&D gets the best support in Safety and Security.
   

  

 Your leadership will be crucial in ensuring that the group functions effectively and that all members feel engaged and motivated in their work. You will need to use your leadership skills to create a positive work environment where everyone feels valued and appreciated. This is an exciting and challenging role that requires strong leadership skills, with the ability to work strategically and with a long-term focus.
   

  

 To be successful in the position you need to have experience of work environment within the engineering industry as well as very good knowledge of Swedish work environment legislation. You are also very familiar with Scania's overall policies and guidelines and have a desirable experience in the security area with physical security, personnel security, etc.
   

  

 As a person you like to speak and express yourself in front of a group and you believe in building relationships with teams and stakeholders, inspiring and motivating others to work towards a goal.
   

  

 The position require that you communicate fluently in Swedish and English both in speech and writing.
   

  

 It is an advantage if you have training and experience in the security area.
   

  

**Scania offer**
 We offer a dynamic, agile and collaborative environment where your knowledge and skills are highly valued. You will be encouraged to take initiatives and dare to try new things as part of an agile and empowered development team.
   

  

 Scania’s culture is characterized by openness, diversity and respect for the individual. The people who work here are our most important asset, so we will invest in you to help you grow with us.
   

  

 As a Scania employee, you are offered several benefits in addition to personal and professional development opportunities. These benefits include mutual bonus, leasing car, occupational pension and flexible working hours.
   

  

**Further information**
 Please contact Corey Liljeqvist, Head of R&D Real Estate EMEC, +46 8 553 725 74 or current manager Josef Pilot, EMECS, +46 8 553 521 70
   

  

**Application**
 Welcome with your application, which should contain your CV, as soon as possible but at the latest 27th of June. Selections will be made continuously during the application period.
   

  

 Please notice that for this position, we might conduct a background check for the final candidate.
   

  

*Scania is a world-leading provider of transport solutions. Together with our partners and customers we are driving the shift towards a sustainable transport system. In 2022, we delivered 80,238 trucks, 4,994 buses as well as 13,400 industrial and marine power systems to our customers. Net sales totalled to over SEK 170 billion, of which 21 percent were services related. Founded in 1891, Scania now operates in more than 100 countries and employs some 57,000 people. Research and development are mainly concentrated in Sweden. Production takes place in Europe and Latin America with regional product centres in Africa, Asia and Eurasia. Scania is part of TRATON GROUP. For more information visit: www.scania.com*

title: HR-chef
description:
Har du en gedigen HR-erfarenhet och är en person som, liksom våra medlemmar, vill mer? Drivs du av utveckling, både din egen och verksamhetens? På några få år har vi bildat, byggt och utvecklat Akavia och söker nu en HR-chef som vill vara med och forma Akavias framtid.
 



  





**Om oss** 




 Akavia är fackförbundet för ekonomer, jurister, samhällsvetare, IT-akademiker, personalvetare och kommunikatörer. Vi samlar 140 000 medlemmar vilket gör oss till det tredje största förbundet inom Saco. Namnet Akavia betyder den akademiska vägen och bygger på löftet att varje medlem ska få utväxling på sin akademiska utbildning genom hela arbetslivet. Akavia är partipolitiskt obundet och arbetar för ett utvecklande och hållbart yrkesliv med högt välbefinnande.
 



  





**Om rollen** 




 Som Akavias HR-chef ansvarar du för att leda, driva och utveckla Akavias HR-arbete i linje med förbundets övergripande mål och värdegrund. 
 



  





 Du arbetar nära verksamheten med både strategiska och operativa frågor inom hela HR-området. Du utvecklar och kvalitetssäkrar processer och arbetssätt inom bl a kompetensförsörjning, ledarskap, kultur, mångfald, arbetsmiljö, lönebildning och samverkan med fackliga parter. I ditt HR-team ingår en HR-partner och en administratör.
 



  





 Ett av dina viktiga uppdrag är att utveckla och implementera strategier och verktyg för att Akavia ska ha rätt bemanning, gott ledarskap och en kultur som präglas av hög effektivitet, högt engagemang och välbefinnande. Du kommer att vara en nyckelperson i vårt pågående kulturarbete där vi samlar förbundets medarbetare och förtroendevalda för att nå Akavias mål.
 



  





 I rollen som HR-chef ingår även ansvar för en stabsfunktion bestående av två medarbetare med uppgift att koordinera, utveckla och samordna stöd till Akavias förtroendemannaorganisation. 
 



  





 Som en del av Akavias ledningsgrupp kommer du att delta i och bidra till verksamhetsutveckling, kulturbyggande, strategiarbete och bidra med HR-expertis i olika frågor. Du rapporterar till vd.
 



  





**För att lyckas och trivas i rollen** 




  





 Du har en gedigen och bred erfarenhet inom HR-området av både operativt och strategiskt arbete. Du har arbetat nära verksamheten med stöd till chefer i olika frågor. Vi ser gärna att du också har erfarenhet av arbete med ledarskapsutveckling, kulturbyggande och förändringsarbete.
 



  





 Du har en akademisk utbildning inom HR eller inom ett annat närliggande utbildningsområde.
 



 Du är en grundad, modig och driven person som åstadkommer resultat på ett tryggt och genomtänkt sätt. Vidare har du hög integritet, gott omdöme samt lätt för att samarbeta och etablera förtroende. Du är lösningsinriktad och vågar utmana befintliga rutiner och arbetssätt för verksamhetens bästa.
 



  





 Som ledare är du trygg, ger ramar och riktning, leder med tillit och har ett coachande förhållningssätt.
 



  





**Inte som andra förbund** 




 Vår grunduppfattning är att akademisk utbildning ska löna sig. Vi tror på individens förmåga att ta eget ansvar för sin professionella utveckling, anställningsbarhet och konkurrenskraft. Våra medlemmar utgör tillsammans en stark part på arbetsmarknaden i ett förbund med professionsfokus och ambitionen att utveckla moderna kollektivavtal.
 



 Akavia vill vara en attraktiv arbetsgivare som bidrar till ett hållbart arbetsliv. Vi tillämpar hybridarbete med möjlighet att delvis arbeta utanför kontoret. Vi har ett fördelaktigt kollektivavtal med flexibla förmåner och ett modernt kontor på Nybrogatan i Stockholm.
 



  





**Är du rätt person för oss?** 




  





 Varmt välkommen med din ansökan med CV och personligt brev så snart som möjligt och senast den 18 augusti 2024. Urval kommer att ske löpande och tjänsten kan komma att tillsättas innan den 18 augusti.
 



  





 Vi samarbetar i den här rekryteringen med Just Right AB. Vid frågor, välkommen att kontakta:
 



 Rekryteringskonsult Anna-Karin Engvall, tfn 0707-323007, e-post: annakarin.engvall@justright.se eller
 



 Rekryteringskonsult Catarina Isaksson, tfn 072- 205 45 48, e-post: catarina.isaksson@justright.se
 



  





 Facklig kontaktperson för frågor om tjänsten är Kamilla Rosendahl, kamilla.rosendahl@akavia.se, 010-3037636.

title: Group Procurement Manager
description:
We are looking for a dedicated person who wants to be part of leading our global procurement team.
 



  





**ABOUT THE ROLE** 




 In this role, you and your team will be responsible for leading procurement within our group Scandi Standard, with companies in Denmark, Finland, Ireland, Norway, and Sweden, the leading supplier of poultry products in the Nordics.
 



  





 You ensure that the procurement process, from inquiry to contract, is carried out efficiently and in line with the company's strategy and goals. You develop and implement category strategies focusing on economic competitiveness, contract compliance, and sustainability. Furthermore, you implement and optimize processes and ensure smooth operations through close collaboration with key stakeholders in our various companies and countries. You identify areas for improvement and propose efficiencies and long-term solutions. Additionally, you lead and develop employees within the Group Procurement function to ensure high-quality support to the group.
 



  





 To ensure presence and engagement in our business, regular travel between countries is required for this position. Possible locations may include Farre in Denmark, Stockholm in Sweden, or Lieto in Finland.
 



  





**ABOUT YOU** 




 We are looking for a candidate with an academic background in economics, procurement, or logistics and experience in both national and international procurement. You also have experience in a leadership position in procurement, preferably within a group or corporate function, with documented stakeholder management and successful leadership of transformation projects. Your expertise includes procurement processes such as S2C, SRM, and P2P, as well as modern procurement principles such as compliance, sustainability, and digitalization.
