title: Data Engineer
description:
**Data Engineer**
 Podme was founded in 2017 with a vision to enrich everyday life by taking podcast entertainment to its full potential. Podme is your go-to place for quality podcasts, and brings you a fresh selection of curated content, including popular titles found nowhere else.
   

  

 Backed by Schibsted News Media , the largest media group in Scandinavia, we are now on a growth journey demanding strong data capabilities.
   

  

 If you love a great story and want to help shape the future of audio content, join Podme and be part of our exciting journey! We are seeking a
 **Data Engineer** 
 to join our team in Stockholm and help us unlock our full potential. In this role, you will utilize your data engineering skills to support our mission.
   

  

**Responsibilities:**
* Design, build, and maintain our data warehouse, including fact, dimension, and aggregated tables.
* Develop and optimize ELT processes for performance, reliability, and scalability.
* Implement data security and privacy policies and practices.
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams to identify business requirements and create data-driven solutions.
* Stay current with the latest technologies and best practices.
* Deepen your knowledge of our data by designing and implementing our data modeling.
* Take ownership of the key features you deliver.


**Qualifications:**
* Expertise in data warehousing, including data ingestion and modeling.
* Experience with data historization, particularly Slowly Changing Dimensions (SCD) Type II.
* Strong SQL and Python programming skills.
* Analytical mindset with strong data skills to analyze information and build robust data pipelines for complex challenges.
* Excellent collaboration and communication skills for working with various stakeholders.
* Curiosity, adaptability, and a balance between speed and precision.
* Understanding of data integrity and privacy policies.


**Advantages:**
* Familiarity with Google Cloud Platform (GCP), BigQuery, and ETL tools such as Airflow, dbt, and Apache Beam.
* Experience with infrastructure management tools like Terraform and CI/CD pipelines.
* Aptitude for A/B testing.


**Why Join Us?**
 We are a vibrant team dedicated to advancing the world of podcasting. As a Data Engineer, you’ll work alongside passionate data professionals at a growing company shaping the future of audio content.
   

  

* Dynamic Work Environment: Thrive in a fast-paced, innovative culture where your work fuels our mission to elevate the podcast experience.
* Collaborative Team: Contribute to an inclusive atmosphere centered around knowledge-sharing and teamwork, where your insights are valued.
* Impactful Work: Play a vital role in building and maintaining data infrastructure to empower creators in producing high-quality podcasts.
* Continuous Learning and Growth: Develop your skills through code reviews, pair programming, and tech talks. Join hack days and other events that foster creativity.
* Flexibility and Work-Life Balance: Balance remote work with 2-3 days per week in our Stockholm office.
* Wellness and Healthcare: Enjoy comprehensive healthcare insurance and wellness allowances.
* Access to Premium Podcasts: Gain insider access to Podme's premium podcasts and learn from the content you help create.


 Note: Relocation package is not currently available.
   

  

 If you're ready to help shape the future of podcast entertainment and join a passionate team, we'd love to hear from you!

title: C++ Developer - XRY Core Technology
description:
*The MSAB vision is to empower every investigation with digital forensic solutions – for a safer world. We are the global leader in digital forensic technology for mobile device examination and analysis, with the sole focus of on delivering high quality digital forensic solutions to collect, review, analyze and manage data. MSAB is a trusted partner to Law Enforcement, Defense Forces, Government Agencies and Forensic Laboratories in democratic countries throughout the world enabling them to investigate crime, gather intelligence, investigate fraud and fight corruption. Our core values are to run an ethics-driven company with innovation and results.*
**About The Role**
 The XRY Core Technology Team is responsible for managing all our data formats. Responsibilities include decoding a wide range of image, audio, video, text and filesystem data formats making them available for querying and analysis.
   

  

 As a member of the XRY Core Technology team you will be working on storage for various types of evidence data in a reliable and efficient manner. Day-to-day activities include implementing support for new features, dependency management, documentation, and assisting all product teams to leverage our core technology efficiently.
   

  

**Must have:**
* At minimum, 4 years of experience with C++ (writing, testing, debugging and profiling)
* Interest for data storage and ontology models including RDF
* Experience building distributed systems


**Nice to have:**
* Knowledgeable of compression algorithms for sound, video or similar
* Competence within CI/CD and specifically VCPKG
* Competence within .NET and C# development
* Competence within Python development
* Competence within CUDA programming
* Previous industry experience within digital forensics


**What We Can Offer...**
 Create a safer world with us!
   

  

 As one of the world’s leading digital forensics companies, MSAB leads the way in pioneering advancements that contribute to making our world safer.
   

  

 Your work at MSAB will bridge the gap between technology and justice. You’ll be inspired to go beyond your comfort zone, and you’ll deal with challenging and meaningful projects. When you join us, you become part of a global team that aspires to create a safer digital future, one breakthrough at a time.
   

  

 We can offer you an exciting work environment, where we value being innovative, acting ethically and delivering results in everything we do while our customers' needs are at the center. We are proud to be a fast-growing international company with more than 20+ nationalities and we work with things that really make a difference.
   

  

 Every day at MSAB is an opportunity to redefine the future of digital forensics.
   

  

**Are you up for the challenge?**
 Send in your application now!
   

  

 For more information about the role, please contact susanne.kjellman@msab.com.

title: Erfaren .NET Utvecklare till Fintech-bolag på uppgång
description:
Nu är vi på jakt efter en .Net utvecklare till ett härligt Fintech bolag här i Stockholm. Du kommer tillsammans med ett agilt team utveckla skräddarsydda finansiella lösningar till era kunder på en social och rolig arbetsplats. Så om du har jobbat med C# utveckling i tre år eller mer, sök nu!
 



  

**Plats :**
 Stockholm innerstan
 



  

**Jobbkategori :**
 IT
 



  

**Omfattning :**
 Heltid, Tillsvidare
 



  

**Startdatum :**
 Så snart som möjligt
 



  

**Typ av uppdrag :**
 Rekrytering
 



  

**Övrigt :**
 Möjlighet till distansarbete
   




**Om tjänsten**

 Som .NET-utvecklare hos vår kund som levererar finansiella lösningar till sina kunder kommer du att vara en nyckelmedlem i teamet av utvecklare där du är delaktig i att designa, utveckla och underhålla applikationer. Du kommer att arbeta med en bred portfölj av projekt, samarbeta i team där kvalité är av största vikt och skriva kod av.
 


  


 Bolaget är del av en större koncern som funnits i snart 25 år. Nu testar de vingarna och har brutit sig ut från moderskeppet och i och med det anställer de fler kollegor. Du kommer att vara baserad på kontoret i Stockholm med en flexibilitet att jobba hemifrån 50% av tiden.
 


  


  

**Du erbjuds**



  

  
* En arbetsplats med härliga kollegor och bra arbetsklimat
  
* En attraktiv lön
  
* Nyrenoverade lokaler mitt inne i stan med hemtrevlig stämning
  

  


**Arbetsuppgifter**
  
* Utveckla och underhålla .NET-applikationer i C#
  
* Arbeta i en agil möjlig där du kommer samarbeta med flera olika team-kollegor dagligen
  
* Felsöka och lösa programvarufel och problem
  
* Då högkvalitativ kod är av största prioritet kommer ni kodgranska tillsammans
  
* Du kommer vara med och ta beslut kring design och arkitektur
  

  


**Vi söker dig som**
  
* Har minst 3 års erfarenhet av .Net utveckling, med huvuddelen i frontend
  
* Är väl bevandrad inom C# programmering
  
* Har kunskap av att jobba i databaser och SQL
  
* Språk: Svenska och engelska flytande i tal och skrift
  
* Utbildning: En akademisk examen inom systemutveckling, datateknik eller liknande
  


  

  

  

  

  


 För att lyckas i rollen ser vi att du är en driven individ som tycker om att lära dig nya tekniker och hålla dig uppdaterad på det senaste.
 


  


  

**För att lyckas i rollen har du följande personliga egenskaper:**



  

  
* **Problemlösande**
  
* **Samarbetsorienterad**
  
* **Driven**
  
* **Konsultmässig**
  


  

  

**Vår rekryteringsprocess**
  


 Denna rekryteringsprocess hanteras av Academic Work och vår kunds önskemål är att alla frågor rörande tjänsten skickas till Academic Work.
 


  


 Vi tillämpar löpande urval och kommer plocka ner annonsen när tillräckligt många kandidater har nått slutskedet i rekryteringsprocessen. Rekryteringsprocessen innehåller två urvalstest: ett personlighetstest och ett test i kognitiv förmåga. Testerna är ett verktyg för att kunna hitta den kandidat med högst potential för tjänsten samt främja jämlikhet, mångfald och en rättvis rekryteringsprocess.
 



 Detta är en direktrekrytering, vilket betyder att den kandidat som får tjänsten blir direktanställd av kundföretaget. Rekryteringsprocessen hanteras av Academic Work.
   




**Har du frågor om tjänsten?**

 Nils Norgren eller någon av kollegorna i rekryteringsteamet svarar dig gärna på nils.norgren@academicwork.se Ange annons-ID i ditt mail: 15105257

title: Data Engineer - Data Products
description:
Join the Data & AI Revolution at Schibsted Media!
   

  

 Data Products is a part of the Data & AI division, centrally positioned within Schibsted Media, and committed to driving innovation and delivering exceptional value. Our mission is to establish Schibsted as a data-driven pioneer. As a member of the Data Products team, you’ll develop and maintain highly reusable data products that enhance analytical capabilities and support AI applications across our media brands. We’re all about creating scalable data solutions that address today’s challenges and anticipate tomorrow’s needs.
   

  

**The Role:**
 We’re seeking passionate Data Engineers to join our newly formed Data Products team. This is a unique opportunity to be one of the founding members of the team, shaping its direction and defining your role from the ground up. In this position, you will be instrumental in designing robust data models, developing and optimising high-performance data pipelines, and ensuring the quality and integrity of our data products. You will also have the chance to explore and implement cutting-edge technologies to enhance our data infrastructure. If you are driven by innovation, eager to tackle challenges, and ready to make a significant impact, we would love to hear from you.
   

  

**What You’ll Do:**
* Design, develop, and maintain scalable data pipelines and ETL/ELT processes to handle large data volumes from our media brands, including processing billions of daily events from millions of users.
* Ensure data products are current, secure, well-documented, and accessible for analytics and real-time applications like ML models or live dashboards.
* Contribute to a data product catalogue to enhance data product discoverability within Schibsted Media.
* Implement data security and privacy best practices.
* Establish and enforce data quality standards to maintain the accuracy, consistency, and reliability of data products across all systems.
* Proactively identify and address potential data issues, bottlenecks, and opportunities for improvement.


**Who You Are:**
* Proven experience as a Data Engineer or in a similar role.
* Solid understanding of data modelling, ETL/ELT processes, and data warehousing.
* Experience delivering production-grade data pipelines using e.g. SQL, Python, and Rest APIs.
* Experience with modern data engineering tools, e.g. Snowflake, dbt, Airflow, with a curiosity for emerging technologies.
* Familiarity with CI/CD pipelines and infrastructure-as-code tools like Terraform is a plus.
* Good communication skills with fluency in English.
* Collaborative team player who excels in sharing knowledge and working with others to achieve common goals.
* Proactive and take ownership of tasks and projects, ensuring timely and high-quality delivery.


**Why Join Us?**
* High degree of influence in shaping and developing your role further.
* Creative and up-to-date environment that offers great learning opportunities and active engineering communities.
* Flexible working hours and a hybrid work mode, with offices in Oslo and Stockholm.
* International environment with colleagues from around the globe.
* Great company benefits which also include Insider access to premium news and podcasts.


**Ready to shape the future of media with data? Apply now to become a part of our pioneering team at Schibsted Media!**

title: Senior Data Engineer
description:

 At Redeploy Insight, we specialize in building modern cloud data platforms to serve clients across the Nordics to enable enterprise-scale analytical capabilities. Our core focus lies in delivering cutting-edge solutions, including consulting expertise, managed services, and SaaS Data & AI platforms. We take pride in our strategic partnerships with industry leaders such as Microsoft & Databricks, positioning ourselves at the forefront of technological innovation.
   

  

 Redeploy Insight has successfully delivered large-scale and innovative data platforms to Electrolux, Coop, Folksam, PostNord, and Handelsbanken to name a few. Our dedicated team is passionate about enabling enterprise-scale analytical capabilities, empowering our clients to gain profound insights and make informed, impactful decisions.
   

  

 The demand for cloud based analytical platforms is constantly growing and we are now looking for a Senior Data Engineer to join our growing team in Stockholm or Gothenburg. You will work in a fast-paced environment where you will collaborate with some of the most brilliant minds in the field and contribute to the evolution of our platforms with your expertise Data Engineering.
   

  

**About The Role**
 As a Senior Data Engineer in our backend team, you will help to ensure that data pipelines and data stores are high-performing, efficient, organized, and reliable, given a specific set of business requirements and constraints. You will deal with unanticipated issues swiftly and minimize data loss. You will also design, implement, monitor, and optimize data platforms to meet the data pipeline needs.
   

  

 In this role we see that you have solid knowledge of data processing languages, such as SQL, Python, or Scala, and an understanding of parallel processing and data architecture patterns.
   

  

****To be considered for the role, we see that you come with the following experiences and skills:****
* Technical University degree in Computer Science, Information Technology or Engineering.
* At least 3 years of experience as data engineer or similar role
* Familiar with Microsoft Azure Data lake, Databricks, SQL database and data warehouse solutions.
* Experience in designing, implementing, and supporting enterprise-scale ETL / ELT pipelines.
* Ability to integrate data from a variety of sources using integration and orchestration tools (e.g. Azure Data Factory).
* Fluency in Swedish and English with good communication skills.


**You are**
* A Social team-player with drive and positive attitude
* Analytical, communicative, and driven
* A flexible person with “Can-do mentality”
* Experienced in planning and executing in your projects


**You would like to work with us if you**
* Want to work with the latest technology and projects within in Analytics and AI
* Are motivated by customer challenges
* Like to work in teams and are humble
* Want to be in a workplace where your thoughts are valued, and your ideas make an impact


**How To Apply**
 If you're ready to launch your career and make a meaningful impact on organizations through your passion for Data Engineering, then don’t hesitate to send in your application by hitting the apply button.
   

  

 We look forward to hearing from you!
   

  

***Note:** 
 To be eligible for the role you need to be based in Stockholm or Gothenburg, or have plans to relocate to either of the locations.*

title: Tech Lead - Omni
description:
Are you a senior software engineer passionate about creating impactful solutions? Join Omni’s Brand Team as our Tech Lead! Work with diverse technologies like AI tools, Next.js, Kubernetes, Swift, Kotlin and more to shape the future of our products.
   

  

 At Omni, every idea counts. We thrive in a collaborative, non-hierarchical culture and offer a hybrid work environment with time for personal projects. Be part of a diverse, international team that values innovation and teamwork. This is an operational role with no formal staff responsibilities, allowing you to focus on technical leadership and hands-on development.
   

  

 Ready to make a difference? Check out the full ad and join us on our exciting journey!
   

  

**Your mission:**
* Chart the course: Lead in technical decisions, take overall responsibility for our technical architecture, and ensure everyone is on the same page.
* Raise the bar: By introducing new technologies and methods, you enhance the efficiency and quality of our work.
* Share knowledge: Be a patient mentor who actively helps the team grow and improves code quality through constructive feedback and advice.
* Solve problems: Proactively identify and manage technical risks, ensuring we stay ahead.
* Take responsibility: In close collaboration with the Product Manager and UX Lead, ensure our projects are delivered on time and with high quality.
* See the big picture: Keep an eye on the current architecture and think ahead to ensure our solutions are robust, scalable, and sustainable over time.


**Who you are:**
* A communication star: You can easily explain complex technical concepts both in writing and verbally so that both other programmers and less technically savvy individuals understand.
* A problem solver: You actively participate in the initiation of new projects and initiatives. You understand business needs and can translate them into technical solutions that the team then brings to life together.
* Flexible and humble: You are open to new ideas and ready to dive into coding and code reviews when needed.
* Experienced: You have a solid background in software development and a passion for sharing your knowledge.
* Interested in media: If you have experience in news services or media and perhaps even use Omni or Omni Ekonomi yourself, we see that as a big plus.


**A Sneak-peak of our Tech Stack:**
* DevOps techniques and infrastructure as code: e.g., Terraform, Docker, Kubernetes, and AWS.
* Web development: JavaScript/TypeScript-based front-end, e.g., React.js/Next.js, and CSS (LESS/SaSS/BEM).
* Node/JS-based back-end development: e.g., Next.js, Express, PostgreSQL, RDS, SNS/SQS, Redis.
* App development for both iOS and Android: e.g., Swift, Kotlin, Jetpack Compose, Swift UI, UI kit.


**What we can offer:**
* An entrepreneurial spirit that creates a developing and stimulating work environment, where everyone’s contributions, knowledge, and ideas are equally valued.
* 45 colleagues who enjoy collaborating across journalism, business and product development. We simply enjoy working together, and it shows in our results.
* 10% of working time is allocated to personal projects/skill development, which you manage yourself.
* A “team first” hybrid workplace with a centrally located modern office space at Kungsbrohuset, Stockholm.
* A close-knit but distributed team located in Stockholm, Oslo, Gdansk, Warsaw, and Ullared that travel to meet up a couple of times per year.


**Due to summer holidays - your application will be processed after the summer.**

title: Säljare för webbsidor till Visimedia
description:
Är du en driven och självgående person med ett intresse för digitala lösningar? Vill du vara en del av ett dynamiskt team hos Visimedia som hjälper företag att växa genom att erbjuda webbsidor med fokus på design och funktion. Då är det dig vi söker!
   

  

**Om företaget**
 Visimedia är en webbyrå med fördjupade kunskaper i webbdesign, webbutveckling, programmering, grafisk design och E-handel. Visimedia har hjälpt företag runt om i landet sedan 2017 och ska nu påbörja en expansion där man söker en stjärna till försäljningen.
   

  

**Om tjänsten**
 Vi söker en engagerad säljare som ska sälja paketerade webblösningar till företag. Du kommer att arbeta självständigt med att identifiera potentiella kunder för att kunna presentera tjänster som täcker kundernas behov. Tjänsten är helt på remote vilket gör att du ges möjlighet att jobba hemifrån. I den här rollen utgår ingen fast lön, utan tjänsten är helt provisionsbaserad. Därför erbjuds du också möjligheten till ett väldigt generöst provisionsupplägg.
   

  

**Dina arbetsuppgifter:**
* Identifiera och kontakta potentiella kunder.
* Presentera och sälja webbsidor.
* Bygga och underhålla kundrelationer.
* Arbeta mot uppsatta försäljningsmål och budgetar.
* Samla in feedback från kunder för att kontinuerligt förbättra tjänsterna.


**Vi söker dig som:**
* Har erfarenhet av försäljning, gärna inom digitala tjänster eller IT.
* Är självgående och resultatorienterad.
* Har för vana att jobba med telefonen som verktyg.
* Har god kommunikativ förmåga och kan skapa förtroende hos kunder.
* Är strukturerad och har förmåga att planera och prioritera ditt arbete.
* Är tekniskt kunnig och har ett intresse för webbutveckling och digital marknadsföring.


**Vi erbjuder:**
* En 100 % provisionsbaserad lön, med goda möjligheter att tjäna mycket pengar.
* Möjlighet att arbeta med spännande och varierande projekt.
* Utvecklingsmöjligheter inom företaget.
* En kreativ och stödjande arbetsmiljö.


**Ansökan**
 Välkommen med din ansökan redan idag. Urval och intervjuer sker löpande, så vänta inte med att skicka in din ansökan!
